name: Labour Relations
description: Introduction to the institutions, issues and legislation affecting the employment relationship in the public and private sectors in Canada, with emphasis on collective bargaining. The economic and political environment, history of the labour movement, union organization, certification, contract negotiation, strikes, dispute resolution, contract administration and grievances.
department: Centre for Industrial Relations and Human Resources
prerequisites: Enrolment in the Employment Relations program (ASSPE1535/ASMAJ1535) or 4.0 or more FCEs and a minimum cgpa of 2.3.
